title: Thomas Cook staff 'held to ransom' as final stranded customers are flown home
text:
Thomas Cook staff kept on after the collapse of the airline are being "held to ransom" and told they will miss out on redundancy pay if they quit for another job, former employees have claimed.

Attendees at a jobs fair in Manchester for the laid-off workforce claimed that staff describe themselves as "detainees", after they were told they will lose any severance payments if they fail to turn up to work.

However, a spokesman for liquidator AlixPartners said that unlike their colleagues who were made redundant when the company entered liquidation, retained staff were paid their September wages and will receive full pay for the month of October.

Many retained staff will be paid for all of October...
